title: Ethers are wiped out in account during sendTransaction or migrations
body:
- [Y] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

#01 Issue
Lost all rinkeby ethers during truffle compile and/or sendTransaction in geth console

## Steps to Reproduce
(A) Rinkeby coinbase is 0x25376e3269172e1811DBF053460dC5b090499f89
(B) eth.sendTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to: eth.accounts[1], value: web3.toWei(5, "ether")})

Please provide the shortest amount of steps to reproduce your issue.
(1) geth --rinkeby --rpc --rpcport "8545" --rpcaddr "0.0.0.0" --rpccorsdomain "http://localhost:8000" --rpcapi="personal,eth,network,web3,net" --ipcpath "~/.ethereum/geth.ipc"
(2) truffle migrate --compile-all --reset --network rinkeby
(3) geth attach

In the Geth console
(1) eth.sendTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to: eth.accounts[1], value: web3.toWei(5, "ether")})

## Expected Behavior
The wipe-out of all ethers has not been encountered before.

## Actual Results
All ethers are wipeout and these mysterious transactions (for account address, 0x25376e3269172e1811DBF053460dC5b090499f89) are depicted in blocks 2429765, 2426633, 2426436 and 2426257.

## Environment
* Operating System: 
Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-1060-aws x86_64)

* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): Truffle v4.1.11 (core: 4.1.11), Solidity v0.4.24 (solc-js)
* node version (`node --version`): v9.11.1
* npm version (`npm --version`): 5.6.0

Hi @samaujs 
+ Could you show your migrations file? 
+ How did you generate your address? It looks possible that Rinkeby ether is being swept by a bot from various addresses to [0x7097f41F1C1847D52407C629d0E0ae0fDD24fd58](https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/address/0x7097f41f1c1847d52407c629d0e0ae0fdd24fd58) which suggests the private key for that address might be in the public domain / not secure.
+ How long have you been using the address? Did you make all of the outgoing transactions (stretching back several months) listed on etherscan [here](https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/txs?a=0x25376e3269172e1811DBF053460dC5b090499f89)?

Hi,


  As per request, please refer to attached migration files (which I don't think is the problem, as it works many times before) and the following details for your reference:

(1) The account address are generated with the command "geth --rinkeby account new";

(2) I did not publish my private key; other than using the address to obtain rinkeby fauet as per instruction from google plus;

(3) I have been using these addresses in the last few months (the first 3 addresses are created months ago and the other 2 are newly created for testing since I lost all the ethers mysteriously) :

["0x25376e3269172e1811dbf053460dc5b090499f89", "0x96849a6a47ef7aa4a4f5eca9ff8d3242ffbe271c", "0x2efc9b04d1595e246f482df8c86a4ae2fe8e0792", "0xb856b88ed8b73ef697dc92b1a92e7e89d8ff89fe", "0x00291f19e140bf4a669ba8252371d404075fa92d"]

(4) This lost of ethers started recently from block 2426257<https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/block/2426257> of the address "0x25376e3269172e1811DBF053460dC5b090499f89".  This is the first encounter.
(5)  One typical series of action is when I obtain the faucet in block 2429754, compile and migrate in block 2429764 and ethers being mysteriously transferred out in block 242965.  This is what happens about 10 hours ago.

(6) The above actions, I have tried multiple times.  It happens even when I transferred ether between my accounts in geth console with the command "eth.sendTransaction({from: eth.accounts[4], to: eth.accounts[3], value: web3.toWei(1, "ether")})".

(7) Lastly, I have tried again about an hour ago, I cannot get the exact time from etherscan (as it is currently out of sync).  Once I obtain the faucet, I made a transfer of 3.9 eth (from "0xb856b88ed8b73ef697dc92b1a92e7e89d8ff89fe" to "0x25376e3269172e1811DBF053460dC5b090499f89"), compile and migrate that works fine as usual before the problem.  But, within 15-20 minutes, the remaining ethers are transferred away again leaving the coinbase (0x25376e3269172e1811DBF053460dC5b090499f89) with 0 ether remaining.

<https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/block/2426257>

--


  Hope the above details are sufficient for locating the problem.

  Please advise what should I do next?  Should I change to a new coinbase and don't use the above addresses anymore?

Your assistance is greatly appreciated.  Thank you.


Best Regards


Sam

@samaujs<https://github.com/samaujs> The account your Rinkeby Eth are being swept to also exists on mainnet<https://etherscan.io/address/0x7097f41f1c1847d52407c629d0e0ae0fdd24fd58> with a balance of ~60 ETH. There's a single comment which says: hi man! are you a cool crowler?.

If you have a chance could you open an issue at go-ethereum here<https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues> and provide the same information you've provided in this issue? They might have a clearer sense of what's going on.

In the interim I would not use any addresses generated by your local geth client for any real transactions.

I used “https://faucet.rinkeby.io”, is there any problem with this site?

@samaujs I see you got a response at Geth - this is important so I'm leaving a note here in case other people run into the same issue. The core problem is the setting: `--rpcaddr "0.0.0.0"` which [allows anyone](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/wiki/Running-in-Docker#running-in-docker) to access the node from outside. The lead Geth dev notes at [your issue](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/16936#issuecomment-396179383):
> Did you run your node with the RPC port open publicly? If yes, anyone from the internet could have been connected to your node, and signed a number of transactions with your account to both sweep its current funds as well as to transfer any future funds received. There are active attacks on mainnet and all testnets that exploit vulnerable setups.

> Please make sure that you don't ever run publicly reachable RPC, and ideally don't unlock your account, rather use the one-shot personal.sendTransaction.

Going to close this because it's not Truffle related but thank you very much for reporting! This will be helpful to a lot of people.

Unfortunately, tokens are transferred again today to the same account **"https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/address/0x7097f41f1c1847d52407c629d0e0ae0fdd24fd58"**
at block **"2464270"**
with the following details :
(1) The account is unlocked with Metamask and not geth; within only appropriately 20 minutes, ethers are being transferred 
(2) geth --rinkeby --rpc --rpccorsdomain "http://localhost:8000" --rpcapi="personal,eth,network,web3,net" --ipcpath "~/Library/Ethereum/geth.ipc"
with  **--rpcaddr "0.0.0.0"**  removed
